.ansi-bold { font-weight: bold; }
</style>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>When we transmit a signal it gets distorted due to different reasons. So there should be a method to identify the transmitted signal at the reciever end. In this article we simulate identifying a randomly generated binary signal sequence which is corrupted by Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) using a simple decision rule and demonstrate how Bit Error Rate (BER) and $ Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$ varies with $ \frac{E_s}{N_0}$ value. Furthermore we investigate the relationship between BER and $ Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%</span><span class="k">pylab</span> inline
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Populating the interactive namespace from numpy and matplotlib
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">scipy.special</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">erfc</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="o">*</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">plt</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Signals representing 0 and 1 respectively</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s_1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="p">;</span> <span class="n">s_2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1j</span><span class="p">;</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img src="data/optimum_reception/geometric_representation.svg" alt="">$\label{fig:geo}$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here we have considered $E_s$ to be 1.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Look up table for the purpose of bit to complex mapping</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s_lookup</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">s_1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">s_2</span><span class="p">]);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Input set; $E_s\over N_0$ (gamma) values in dB</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">gamma_decibel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">cases</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gamma_decibel</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$N_0\over E_s$ value set. As $E_s = 1$, that value will be just $N_0$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">N_0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">0.1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">gamma_decibel</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">N_0_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tile</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">N_0</span><span class="p">,(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">));</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Generate an equi-probable random bit array of size $10^5$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">bit_seq_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">randint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">cases</span><span class="p">));</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Transmitted signal sequence</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">s_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">s_lookup</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">bit_seq_MAT</span><span class="p">];</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Random complex noise</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">n_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">N_0_MAT</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mf">2.</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">randn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">cases</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1j</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">random</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">randn</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">cases</span><span class="p">));</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Received signal sequence</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">r_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">s_MAT</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">n_MAT</span><span class="p">;</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Decoded bit sequence at the receiver according to the decision rule:</p>
<p>$|r-s_1|<|r-s_2|$  $\rightarrow$  map $r$ to $s_1$ which is $0$</p>
<p>otherwise map $r$ to $s_2$ which is $1$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">t_MAT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">abs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r_MAT</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">s_2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o"><=</span><span class="nb">abs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r_MAT</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">s_1</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Error occurs when an element of t(i.e. decoded bit sequence) is
not equal to corresponding element of bit_seq(i.e. transmitted bit
sequence). When there’s an error, the absolute difference of the
corresponding elements will be $1$. So:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">error_bit_count</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">abs</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t_MAT</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">bit_seq_MAT</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Saving bit error rate values</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ber</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">error_bit_count</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mf">10.</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Calculating $E_s\over N_0$ values which is gamma. ($E_s=1$)</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">gamma_</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">1.</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">N_0</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Define Q-function $Q(x)=\frac{1}{2}erfc\left(\frac{x}{\sqrt{2}}\right)$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">qfunc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">erfc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Calculate $Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">qfunc</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sqrt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gamma_</span><span class="p">));</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Plotting the graphs in log scale</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">semilogy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gamma_decibel</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ber</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'BER'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">marker</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'x'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'r'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ls</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'dashed'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">semilogy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gamma_decibel</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">q</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'$\sf Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">marker</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'+'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ls</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'dashed'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">legend</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># upper left corner</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'$\sf\frac{E_s}{N_0}(dB)$'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">18</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'BER and $ Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$ Vs $ \frac{E_s}{N_0}$'</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">grid</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="o">=.</span><span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linestyle</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'dashed'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This result is no wonder but a mere application of probability theory. We can show it as follows:</p>
<p>As the name suggests bit error rate (BER) is the relative frequency of occurring an error. (See the Appendix for more details.) It is a fundamental fact in probability theory that as the number of trials tends to infinity, the relative frequency of an event reaches the probability of occurring that event. Since the number of bits in our bit sequence is large enough ($10^5$), we can safely say that BER is nothing but the probability of occurring an error at the receiver, $P(E)$. We now show that $P(E)=Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)$.</p>
<p>$$
\begin{align*}
P(E)&=P(E\cap\boldsymbol {s_1})+P(E\cap\boldsymbol {s_2})\\
    &=P(E|\boldsymbol {s_1})P(\boldsymbol{s_1})+P(E|\boldsymbol {s_2})P(\boldsymbol{s_2})
\end{align*}$$</p>
<p>As $P(\boldsymbol{s_1})=P(\boldsymbol{s_2})=\frac{1}{2}$ and $P(E|\boldsymbol {s_1})=P(E|\boldsymbol {s_2})$</p>
<p>$$P(E)=P(E|\boldsymbol{s_1})$$</p>
<p>By looking at Figure, we can show that,</p>
<p>$$P(E|\boldsymbol{s_1})=P\left(\Im(\boldsymbol {s_1}+\boldsymbol n)>\Re(\boldsymbol {s_1}+\boldsymbol n)\right)$$</p>
<p>Which yields,</p>
<p>$$P(E)=P\left(\boldsymbol {n_C}-\boldsymbol{n_R}>\sqrt{E_s}\right)$$</p>
<p>Since,</p>
<p>$$\boldsymbol{n_c}-\boldsymbol{n_R}\sim N(0,N_0)$$</p>
<p>the probability of error becomes,</p>
<p>$$\begin{align*}
P(E)&=P\left(\frac{\overline{\boldsymbol{n_C}-\boldsymbol{n_R}}-0}{\sqrt{N_0}}>\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)\\
&=Q\left(\sqrt{\frac{E_s}{N_0}}\right)
\end{align*}$$</p>

</div>
</div>
